taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section hispidi;species jacens;

treatment.description: Differing from no. 75 in its copiously glandular, as well as bristly, and more slender canes (2.5-3.5 mm. thick), these rarely so much branching and prolonged; primocane-leaves pale green and chartaceous, with lateral ribs impressed above and very prominent beneath, their leaflets oblong-ovate and 6-7 cm. long by 2-3.5 cm. broad; raceme short or corymbiform; pedicels with few or no glands or bristles, 1-2 cm. long; calyx not glandular; petals 7-10 mm. long, 2.5-4 mm. broad.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: Dry pastures and clearings, s. N.H. to e. N.Y, and Pa. Fl. late June, July; fr. Aug., Sept.
